title: Prisma/Prismania/Prismatic?
content:
There is a typeface called "Prismania" by Headliners Inc., which appears to look similar to "Prisma", a typeface available in Mecanorma/Letraset dry lettering catalogue. Also, there seems to be another typeface called "Prismatic" which revived by Mr. Nick Curtis.  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/pentaprism-nf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150422023911/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/pentaprism-nf/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/pentaprism-nf/")

All of them appears to look the same except that Prismania and Prismatic have some alternates and variant designs...  
Curious which one is a knockoff of which?....

Prisma  
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150422023911im_/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFonts/prisma.gif)

Here is another topic about "Prisma" but the sample posted seems to be slightly different (ie. 7)  
 [http://typophile.com/node/84218](http://web.archive.org/web/20150422023911/http:/typophile.com/node/84218 "http://typophile.com/node/84218")

This topic shows some samples of "Prisma" and "Prismania"
